content.text:
###Monday, March 3, 2014

* Filled out ISMRM Trainee form
  * Updated CV
  * Letter
  * Completed Trainee form
  * Registration Form
* Talked to Nico about the Neeb protocol and NODDI for the **Rebuild project**
  * He sent many papers for me to read
  * Data is in /data/henry6 but I don't have access
* Sent an email to Peter Storey about being added to the henrylab group
* Finished my spectroscopy homework
* Finished summarizing [results](http://nbviewer.ipython.org/urls/dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/9020198/notebooks/Results.ipynb) from rotation 2 at Dr. Sarah Nelson's Lab

###Tuesday, March 4, 2014
####Meeting at Berkeley
#####Simultaneous MultiSlice EPI
* CAIPI - controlled aliasing
* slice leakage increases with # multiband normally, but blipped caipi its not as bad
* Multiband: RF pulse excites multiple slices - get signal with all images layered on each other. use coil strengths to weight signals and separate slices.
* Controlled aliasing - partially separate images in PE
* get better networks from smaller TR even though ~6s fluctuations

#####Multiband EPI
* coil compression - computation cost for reconstruction
* array data is correlated - so we can compress w/out losing signal
* compress before recon and inexpensive
*GRAPPA approach, N=#coils, calibration O(n^3) or O(n^4)
* *Hardware*: Linear comb to reduce #channels "eigencoils"
* *Software*: sensitivity bsed, automatic selection, **data based**
* SVD/PCA based coil compression: kpsace data --> SVD eigenvector matrix
  * **How do you decide what is dominant?**
* FFT on one axis - kspace all coils see, realspace some coils see
  * different compression matrix for each x position for all k_y's
  * 32 channels --> 5 w/ no info loss
  * each line (x pos) has its own SVD, take **5** (why 5?)
    * need to align basis functions (make it "smooth")

#####Motion
* What is G factor? Multiband factor?
* Motion sensitivity: reference scans mess things up
  * get better basis sets - track movement of head

##### DIffusion MRI
* Sensory processing disorder
  * unusual behavioral responses to sensory stuff -- autism & ADHD, premature infants and fragile X
  * abnormal wm microstructure

#####Spectroscopy
* slice selective inversion recovery

###Wednesday, March 5, 2014

* Converting dicoms in /data/henry6/study_reBUILD: in notebook /data/henry6/keshavan/notebooks/Convert_Dicoms

###Thursday, March 6, 2014

* Completed and ran dicom conversion for fMRI, anatomical, and field mapping data
* Submitted a ticket to RadHelp for access to the ms.q grid
* Alyssa is running freesurfer on the anatomicals for the 10 ms subjects for me while I wait for radhelp to give me access

####Potential Issue
* I only see 1 fieldmapping file - epidewarp.fsl takes **2** - a phase and magnitude image
* I might have to write a new workflow using fugue and prelude, instead of using freesurfer's wrapper.

#### Reading: A new method for fast quantitative mapping of absolute water content in vivo

* Can measure absolute water content in the brain
* Clinically useful for brain edema dynamics (edema from stroke, brain tumors, etc)
* New method is based on T1(TAPIR) and T2*(QUTE) 
  * fast, efficient and precise sampling of T2* and T1 curves

#### Homework:
* Did center frequency scan for SSFP sequence
  * /data/bioe5/epic/freq_scan

###Friday, March 7, 2014
* mailed in ISMRM form because I got no confirmation from email  or fax..

####Resting-State fMRI: reBUILD
* running bips workflow 77, just to make sure all nodes work. 
  * No field map
  * No simultaneous, no slice time
  * running locally on euler
  * one subject, ms1649
  * bips 77 works as is!
* make fsaverage 5 corrmap, do interactive display
  * surface corr matrix is breaking.. Because I mapped to the subject's surface instead of fsasverage5!!!
* if this works, delete and figure out how to do fieldmapping

####Homework
  * Spectroscopy homework due

#### Reading: A new method for fast quantitative mapping of absolute water content in vivo
* QUTE = Quantitive T2* Image
* "Quantitative in vivo measurement of water content using MRI is based on the proportionality of the MR signal to the number of protons in an image volume which is again proportional to the water content in that volume"
* only protons from water, not fat contribute to signal. Valid assumption except for fat!
* "Fitting the T 2 relaxation curve results in the determination of the parameter S 0,T2* (tissue), which is the tissue equilibrium magnetization determined from the T 2 map"
* place a reference probe with 100% water in the FOV during measurement (S0,T2* reference)
  * but reference probe as at room temperature
  * affected by B1 inhomogeneities
* Get S_0,T2*: acquire first point at short TE and then extrapolate to timpeoint 0 with 3rd order polynomial

####TODO:

Find a phantom to take to europe! Possibly with asparagus for diffusion.

####BIPS preprocessing 

* needs freesurfer subject directories named the same as subject id's for fMRI data. Here is a notebook that symlinks with the proper name for easy processing.
